H0.text: Cancer is the disease that results from unchecked cell division caused by a breakdown of the mechanisms regulating the cell cycle.

H1.text: Gout is the disease that results from unchecked cell division caused by a breakdown of the mechanisms regulating the cell cycle.

H2.text: Dementia is the disease that results from unchecked cell division caused by a breakdown of the mechanisms regulating the cell cycle.

H3.text: Diabetes is the result of unchecked cell division caused by a breakdown of the mechanisms regulating the cell cycle.

A4.text: A mutation in the error-correcting machinery of a cell might cause that cell and its children to accumulate errors more rapidly.

A5.text: A further mutation may cause the loss of a tumor suppressor gene, disrupting the apoptosis signaling pathway and immortalizing the cell.
